summary: User unable to upgrade go.temporal.io/api from 1.26 to 1.27 due to type incompatibilities with go.temporal.io/sdk 1.25.1. The API library was updated to use newer proto libraries, but SDK version hasn't been released yet to match.
userImpact: Users attempting to upgrade to the latest go.temporal.io/api version encounter compilation errors when using older SDK versions.
rootCause: go.temporal.io/api 1.27 upgraded to new proto libraries (google.golang.org/protobuf), but go.temporal.io/sdk 1.25.1 still uses gogo/protobuf types, causing type incompatibilities.
proposedFix: Use the newest RC of the Go SDK that matches the API version being used, ensuring API and SDK proto library versions align.
workaround: Stay on go.temporal.io/api version compatible with the currently released SDK version (1.25.1 for SDK 1.25.1).
resolutionDetails: This is a usage question rather than a bug. Users must coordinate API and SDK versions - the newest API versions require the newest SDK versions.
keyQuote: To use the newest Go API version, you have to be on the newest RC of the Go SDK.
